acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=24.3microg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,500mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality at the highest dose (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of >320mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >10,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981, 1987)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.18 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 57.7-58.0degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

explosives.rationale: Classification not possible in the absence of data on the decomposition energy, though the substance contains nitro groups with its oxygen budget calculated at  -179, and exothermically decomposes at 230-240degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on false positive data on in vitro reverse mutation tests, negative in vitro data on chromosome aberration tests, DNA repair tests in vitro (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)) and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/mouse teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981, 1996)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 57.7-58.0degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing nitro groups with explosive properties

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea-pig skin sensitization tests using the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification is not possible since no evidence of clinical symptoms which could be used to identify the target organs was observed at doses within the guidance value ranges for Category 2 in the available rat and dog subacute toxicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995, 2005)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
